#Text=Ontario Votes 2007 : Interview with Communist Party candidate Shona Bracken , Toronto Danforth
#Text=Sunday , October 7 , 2007
#Text=Shona Bracken is running for the Communist Party in the Ontario provincial election in Toronto — Danforth .
#Text=Wikinews interviewed her regarding her values , her experience , and her campaign .
#Text=Interview
#Text=Why have you chosen to involve yourself in the political process ?
#Text=Why did you choose to run in this constituency ?

#Text=First of all , I ’m a keen supporter of the “ people ’s agenda ” put forward by our Party , and participating in this election is a very good way to publicize and to win more supporters for the policies we advance .

#Text=As a youth activist , I am particularly concerned about education and other social issues relevant to youth and students – issues like rolling back and eliminating tuition , ending the ‘ corporatization ’ of our campuses , and lowering the voting age to 16 .
#Text=Toronto-Danforth is a predominantly working class , culturally diverse community and what is why I volunteered to carry our party flag in this riding .
#Text=What prior political experience do you have ?
#Text=What skills and insight can you bring to office , from other non-political positions you may have held ?
#Text=I am one of the youngest candidates ( from any of the political parties ) running in this election anywhere in the province .
#Text=Naturally , then , I lack political experience .
#Text=What I lack in experience however , is more than made up by my enthusiasm and fresh approach to the big social and economic issues facing Ontario today , and into the future .
#Text=I am completing an under-graduate program in Sociology at Glendon College of York University .
#Text=I have an elected position on my Students ’ Union as the Director of External Affairs , and also serve on the executive of the Canadian Federation of Students-Ontario .
#Text=Which of your competitors do you expect to pose the biggest challenge to your candidacy ? Why ?
#Text=What makes you the most desirable of all candidates running in the riding ?
#Text=Peter Tabuns , the incumbent MPP representing the NDP in the legislature , is obviously the odds-on favourite to win re-election .
#Text=His party however has continued to water-down its reformist policies in an attempt to ensconce itself into the political ‘ mainstream ’ .
#Text=The NDP has long since abandoned a principled anti-capitalist or socialist program , and that ’s why I think it is important to put forward a Communist alternative .
#Text=What do you feel are the three most important issues to voters in your riding ?
#Text=Are these the same top three issues that are most important to you ?
#Text=What would you do to address these issues ?
#Text=It ’s hard to reduce everything down to three – there are so many vital issues facing us .
#Text=But you asked , so here goes :
#Text=Job & Economic Justice – to reverse the de-industrialization of Ontario , secure more well-paid , unionized jobs , and raise the minimum wage to $15/hour .
#Text=A future for youth – We need to make education a right , not a privilege .
#Text=Student debt is out of control and Ontario has the second highest tuition fees in the country .
#Text=First year student are entering Ontario universities with never-before-seen tuition levels .

#Text=Ultimately , a comprehensive funding formula needs to be put in place to make higher education free , and public schools need the necessary resources to prepare students for higher education , regardless of whether or not they live in a wealthy neighbourhood .

#Text=Peace & Disarmament – I think this really is a provincial issue … we need a legislature at Queen ’s Park that ’s willing to tell Ottawa to “ Get out of Afghanistan Now ! ” ; to cut military spending by 50 % ; and to ban military recruitment from our schools and campuses .
